resources.string: Tick Track
Hello blank fragment
Tick Track\n

Tick Track is designed to enhance time management skills by limiting access to potentially distracting applications during designated task periods. This innovative tool also offers customizable color-coding and pinning features for prioritization and organization of tasks. Tick Track is the result of dedicated research and development by a student team led by Jorge Fuertes. We appreciate your support in downloading our application and trust that it will significantly improve your productivity. Thank you, and we wish you success in completing your tasks with Tick Track.

\tTick Track Service will be responsible for tracking and managing the restriction of applications. It detects whether the user opened a blocked application in the app itself. Without turning this service on, blocking apps would not be possible at all. This feature is the main highlight of the application. Therefore, everyone is encouraged to turn Tick Track Service on.
\tOnce you click the "Block Apps" button, you will be directed to the accessibility settings once you select the "Block Apps" option. You must locate "Tick Track" and turn it on there.
\tTick Track should be visible under downloaded apps. To activate the app, tap its name.
\tPress the Tick Track button to activate the switch.
\tA dialog would pop-up that would show what the service can do in the device. Tap allow to enable the service.
\tThe switch is intended to activate after enabling the service. With the Tick Track app, you can now restrict applications!

\tIn higher versions of Android, Google has implemented stricter security measures for accessibility. As a result, you might encounter a message in applications that are not available on the Google Play Store.
\tOpen your device\'s settings and navigate to the \"Applications\" or \"Application Management\" section.
\tLook for the "Applications List" option within the \"Applications\" or \"Application Management\"
\tScroll down through the Applications List and find the "Tick Track" application.
\t Once you locate the \"Tick Track\" app, you\'ll notice three vertical dots in the upper corner of the application info. Tap on those dots.
\tIn the options that appear, select \"Unlock Restricted Setting\" or \"Allow Restricted Settings\".
\tIt should show a toast message at the bottom of the device. Now, the application could access settings that were prohibited.
\tReturn to the app and press the \"Block Apps\" button once more, or open the Settings menu and select Accessibility. You should now be able to activate Tick Track after finding it once more.
\tTurn the Tick Track switch on and permit it to activate. Applications should now be able to be restricted and blocked directly from within the app.
ssibal
